page.title: 01Bridlington Introduction
page.content: Bridlington is a seaside resort on the east coast of Yorkshire, just south of Flamborough Head. The population of some 29,000 depends largely on tourism and fishing, although the latter has declined in recent years. Within the original Old Town stands the Priory Church and Bayle Gate; the remains of the Augustinian Monastery. The Old Town is also well known for its Georgian frontages and narrow streets. The harbour is home to a small fishing fleet and shelter for many small boats and yachts, pleasure craft and cobles. It is overlooked by Bridlington's only high-rise(11 stories) block of flats. The residential areas near the harbour and centre are taken up with hotels, holiday flats, etc.
